text: On tap at Fair state, pours a clear amber orange with a medium khaki head. Aroma of fruity sweet citrus hops with a steady caramel malt backbone. Taste of steady dry but sweet caramel and toffee malt with dry bitter hops and lager yeast on the finish. Solid well done drinkable Vienna.
Growler. Mcopper color with a tall head. Spicy and floral hop aroma with hints of toasted bread. Herbal hop flavor. Strong biscuit grain. Dry finish.

Minnesota Trip Beer #182. Keg at the brewery, 5/12/16. Clear copper, large creamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of toasted malts, mild hops. The taste is toasted malts, caramel, mild floral hops. Medium bodied, crisp.
On tap at common roots. Deep amber with little head. Aroma is biscuit and slight herbal earthy hop aroma. Cracker and bread dominate the taste with some spiciness finishing. Nice.
Tap - good size foamy head, dark gold color, moderate toasty and nutty malty aroma and flavor, mild hop balance, ok overall
Draft at Republic. Crystal clear golden color, big fluffy white head. Aroma of biscuit and white pepper. Taste has black pepper and freshly baked bread. Delicious.
Keg @ Fair state. Light Amber with a small head. Nice toasty nose. Caramel, some cotton candy, taste is nice and toasty. Grassy bitterness, some caramel. Grain. Medium body, soft carb .

8 oz. pour, on tap at the brewerys taproom in Nordeast Minneapolis, Minnesota. Consumed on 9-10-15. Pours a clear bronze with light effervescence and a moderate amount of beige head. Nice but unspectacular appearance. Fruity-sweet aroma. Caramel scent. Nice, pleasant smell. Amber Ale flavor (I realize this is a lager). Lightly toasted malt taste. Tastes like toast with butter (but not in a diacetyl way). Crisp, lively, good lager palate. Underwhelming but reasonably well made and nice.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with a touch of amber and a near white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has notes of sweet grain and bread with a bit of a crispness underlying. Flavor begins with sweet grain and bread with a crisp finish and a touch of toffee.

Draft. Pale orange in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of lightly toasted malt and a bit of orange marmalade. More gently toasted malt in the mouth, along with herbal hops and bread dough. Medium bodied with a squeaky clean finish. Very drinkable stuff.

Pour on tap at Republic, clear orange gold pour with white head, aroma brought notes of grass, bread, toast, some butter, touch of red fruit, hints of grain. Taste was a mix of grass, biscuit, yeast into a bit of grain, toast, hints of slight vanilla, finishing bitter.

Tap at Fair State. Creamy malt nose, light roast, and some mild grassiness. Clear copper/straw color. Solid malty initial, rich caramel, a bit fizzy. Medium body. Well-balanced and well-constructed Vienna.
Tap at Fair State. Clear yellow pour with a large fluffy white head. Bread and toast, soft malts. Easy drinking with good malty flavor. Pretty solid, and Im not usually a big fan of this style.

At Fair State. Labeled as Vienna only, with no tea infusion. I suspect this was the base beer. I picked up no tea character at all in the normal version. Copper color; it looks right. Dry malt and bread flavors. Minimal hops, and bitter malt flavor with a dry finish. One of the better Viennas I have tried anywhere. Fair State is setting the bar for lagers in Minnesota.
